testsuite.name: features.context-urlhelper.URL helpers are available in behave's context

testcase.classname: features.context-urlhelper.URL helpers are available in behave's context
testcase.name: get_url() is an alias for the base_url property

testcase.classname: features.context-urlhelper.URL helpers are available in behave's context
testcase.name: The first argument in get_url() is appended to base_url if it is a path

testcase.classname: features.context-urlhelper.URL helpers are available in behave's context
testcase.name: The reversed view path is appended to base_url if the first argument in get_url() is a view name
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: The reversed view path is appended to base_url if the first argument in get_url() is a view name When I call get_url("admin:password_change") with a view name ... passed in 0.004s Then this returns the same result as get_url(reverse("admin:password_change")) ... passed in 0.000s And the result is the base_url with reverse("admin:password_change") appended ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.classname: features.context-urlhelper.URL helpers are available in behave's context
testcase.name: The model's absolute_url is appended to base_url if the first argument in get_url() is a model
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: The model's absolute_url is appended to base_url if the first argument in get_url() is a model When I call get_url(model) with a model instance ... passed in 0.000s Then this returns the same result as get_url(model.get_absolute_url()) ... passed in 0.000s And the result is the base_url with model.get_absolute_url() appended ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
